title: Vietnamese-Style Pork Bun Cha Rice Noodles
keywords: Bun Cha, Pork, Rice noodles, Vietnamese, Grilled, Fresh herbs

ingredients.ingredient_name: Carrot Mooli & Pink Cabbage Slaw Mix

method.step: Boil a full kettle
Pell and finely chop (or grate) your garlic
Add your pork mince to a bowl with the chopped garlic, half of the chopped chilli and your tsp sugar
Mix the pork mixture thoroughly until fully combined, then shape into 3 patties per person
Heat a large wide based pan with a drizzle of vegetable oil over a heigh heat.
Once hot, add the patties and cook for 4-5 minutes on each side or until browned on both sides and cooked through
Meanwhile squeezing the juice of half your lime into a small bowl
Add your fish sauce, the remaining chopped chilli your tbsp sugar and a slash of water
Stir it all together until the sugar has dissolved.  This is your nuoc cham
Strip your mint leaves from their stems and chop them roughly discard the stems
Chop your coriander finely, including the stalks
Add your mooli slaw mi to a bowl with half of the chopped coriander, half of the nuoc cham and a pinch of salt
Give everything a good mix up and set aside. This is your quick picked nuoc cham mooli slaw
Add your rice noodles to a pot and cover with boiled water
Bring to the boil over a heigh heat and cook for 4-5 minutes or until cooked with a slight bite
Once cooked with a slight bite, drain the rice noodles and set aside
Once the pork parries are cooked though, add your pho broth paste, ginger & garlic paste and chicken stock mix with your boiled water
Cook for 2-3 minutes this is your pork bun cha
Cut the remaining lime into 1 wedge per person
Serve the cooked rice noodles in a bowl and top with the pork bun cha
Serve the remaining nuoc cham to the side and drizzle over
Garnish with the reserved chilli rounds, chopped mint and remaining chopped coriander and a lime wedge
Serve the quick, pickled nuoc cham mooli slaw to the side and enjoy
